resources.string: The Parthenon is the main ancient structure on the Acropolis, a hill in the center of Athens. It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site, the symbol of Athens and the most famous of the surviving structures from the world of ancient Greece.
Athens\' top must-see attraction and a UNESCO site is the Acropolis, High City or Sacred Rock, a hill overlooking the city and home to the most recognizable symbol of the city, the Parthenon.
The remains of this massive temple stand southeast of the Acropolis. Built in the 2nd century during the Roman era, the temple of Zeus Olympios was the largest in ancient Greece.
On the southern slope of the Acropolis the pedestrian street of Dionysiou Areopagitou is the site of two ancient performance venues – the Dionysos Theatre and the Odeion Theatre of Herodes Atticas.
Dionysiou Areopagitou St., Athens, southern slope of Acropolis
This triumphal arch was erected in the 2nd century AD in honor of the Roman emperor Hadrian. It was probably constructed before Hadrian's visit to Athens on 131/132AD.
Amallias Ave, Athens (entrance to the site of Temple of Olympian Zeus, south of National Gardens)
Visitors to the Agora in Athens get to stroll between what remains of the Roman Forum or center of the city from 19 to 11BC.
North of Acropolis, east of Ancient Agora. Main entrance from side street off Adrianou St. east of Stoa of Attalos.

The Agora or "gathering place" was the heart of ancient Athens. People would come here to do business, shop, be entertained, hear philosophers expounding their views, attend court, go to school, socialize and conduct politics.

The Plaka, a neighborhood at the foot of the Acropolis, will be one of the most enchanting places you visit in Athens even though it is geared towards tourists it has retained a charm and picturesque quality.
Neighborhood northeastern side of Acropolis between Syntagma Square and Monastiraki Square
The Acropolis Museum is ultra modern, bright and state-of-the art. There are five main sections to guide you through a unique perpective on the monumental hill.
Entrance from Dionisiou Areopagitou 15, Makriyianni, Athens 117 42

The building which houses this museum has a long and eventful history.Among the artifacts on display are traditional costumes, memorabilia, flags, furniture, medals and personal items which belonged to historical figures. There is an art collection of historical paintings created by both Greek and foreign artists.
Old Parliament Building, Kolokotronis Square, 13 Stadiou St., Athens
1 Koumpari St. & Vas. Sofias Ave, Athens 106 74

The Cyclades are a group of Greek isles in the Aegean Sea. The Cycladic culture flourished on the islands from 3200BC to 2000BC and the archaeological findings on display in this museum give us insight into the islands' ancient civilization.

This private museum is in the shadow of the Acropolis in a neo-classic building dating back to 1898. The museum\'s goal is to introduce visitors to the world of fine arts by highlighting the work of specific artists who have made a major contribution to art.

o see the largest collection of archaeological findings from Greece visit this centrally located museum. The huge neo-classical building was expanded in several stages to make room for the growing collection.
With so many of the city\'s sites devoted to the ancient civilizations of Athens it is refreshing to visit this museum which focuses on the modern history of the Greek capital.
The Museum of Greek Handicraft was founded in 1918 and in 1959 its name was changed to the Museum of Greek Folk Art. The museum has four sections each housed in a different location.

Immerse yourself in the myths and monuments of classical Greece on this full-day tour of Delphi from Athens.Explore the UNESCO-listed archeological site of Delphi with an expert guide and learn how the city was considered the ‘Center of the World’ in ancient Greece.
Hydra, Poros and Egina Day Cruise from Athens

Discover three beautiful Greek islands on this full-day cruise from Athens. Sail to Poros, Hydra and Egina in the Saronic Gulf and enjoy free time at each island to stroll, sightsee and shop as you wish.
Cape Sounion and Temple of Poseidon Half-Day Trip from Athens

Marvel over one of Greece’s most photographed monuments on this half-day tour to the Temple of Poseidon from Athens. You’ll have chance to get up close to the ancient monument, explore ruins dating back to 44 B.C and soak up the impressive coastal views.
City Sightseeing Athens, Piraeus & Beach Riviera Hop-On Hop-Off Tour

Experience the best of Athens in one day and your own way, with this City Sightseeing hop-on hop-off Athens bus tour. . Travel around by open-top double-decker bus and create your own sightseeing itinerary.

Eat dinner in a revolving restaurant suspended in the sky during this 1.5-hour experience in Athens. From a bird\'s eye view at 165 feet (50 meters) in the air, get views of the city of Athens lit up at night

Experience the electric atmosphere of Athens by night on this 3-hour bar-hopping tour. Join your local guide and fellow party-lovers for an evening of Greek-style entertainment and get the inside scoop on the city’s nightlife.

Explore the ruins of ancient Corinth and see the Corinth Canal on this Athens half-day tour. Stroll around the relics of Corinth, once an influential ancient Greek and Roman city, and then visit the seaside town of Kehreai before your return to Athens.
Hidden Athens Walking Tour and Picnic: Plaka and the Hills of Athens

Escape the well-trodden tourist track and discover a quieter side of Athens on this leisurely 3.5-hour to 4-hour walking tour. With a local guide, explore the tucked-away areas around the slopes of the Acropolis and uncover their ancient and recent past.
A cozy winebar on walking distance from Acropolis Museum.Its owners, Andreas and Alex welcome you very friendly, and will give you their best advice about their delicious wine and appetizers.
A little gem of a distillery in the Plaka area. Beautiful deco, delectable self distilled spirits and friendly service make for a delightful cocktail. A must see on a trip to Athens!

A really cool bar with an open courtyard where you can relax with a well-made cocktail. A bit hidden away, but that only adds to the experience. There is also an art gallery on the premises, but make sure you come early if you want to see the art
The outside rooftop bar is busy as it has great view. Recommended for a cool drink with excellent view of the Acropolis and the surrounding areas so be sure not to forget your camera!

There\'s a reason this place is one of the best. he cocktail list is expansive and original. The bartenders are artists with flavor. The atmosphere is excellent.It\'s worth paying extra for the care and attention.
A traditional pub with amazing beers. The selection of beers is excellent, the staff is superb, and the atmosphere of regular guests made it an excellent place.
Great little oasis on a hot day in Athens. High on positive vibes, great atmosphere, friendly family owners, and friendly patrons. A must visit for anyone looking for a fun evening.
An excellent place to taste carefully selected wines,local and international! The space is beautifully decorated,wine oriented and you can also have delicious dishes to combine with your wine.
